channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN

item.title: Report E-2023110187
item.description:
Report E-2023110187

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A (1-G) jug arrived leaking due to being improperly secured. About (1-G) released which was contained to/soaked into a piece of plywood and quickly evaporated. The spill was cleaned and all materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110627
item.description:
Report X-2023110627

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET AND MISSING HALF THE BOX. DescribePack: CAPS ON GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES LOOSE AND BOTTLES CRUSHED ON SIDES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKED A LITTLE OUT OF EACH BOTTLE.

item.title: Report X-2023110570
item.description:
Report X-2023110570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered this morning on the inbound and removed from the van it was scanned to. someone placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023110248
item.description:
Report X-2023110248

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR DROVE THEIR TRAM OVER TO THE DMP AND INFORMED OF A HAZMAT (CLASS 5.1 AND 8) THAT WAS EMITING A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR AND WAS CONCERNED THAT IT MAY BE LEAKING. RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX AND UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND 1 OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A CAP THAT WAS ON CROOKED AND HAD ALLOWED SOME OF ITS CONTENTS TO BE RELEASED INTO THE CONTAINER.
